Rename variables

Source: R/var_labels.R
var_rename.Rd

This function renames variables in a data frame, i.e. it renames the columns of the data frame.

var_rename(x, ...)

Arguments

x

A data frame.
...

Pairs of named vectors, where the name (lhs) equals the column name that should be renamed, and the value (rhs) is the new column name.

Value

x, with new column names for those variables specified in ....

Examples

# Set variable labels for data frame
dummy <- data.frame(a = sample(1:4, 10, replace = TRUE),
                    b = sample(1:4, 10, replace = TRUE),
                    c = sample(1:4, 10, replace = TRUE))

var_rename(dummy, a = "first.col", c = "3rd.col")
#>    first.col b 3rd.col
#> 1          3 4       4
#> 2          4 2       2
#> 3          1 2       4
#> 4          4 2       3
#> 5          1 2       2
#> 6          3 1       3
#> 7          1 1       2
#> 8          2 3       3
#> 9          1 3       3
#> 10         3 4       1
